item.title: web crawler
item.description: 爬取链家网 https://cd.lianjia.com/ershoufang/ rm(list=ls()) library(“xml2”) library(“rvest”) library(“dplyr”) library(“stringr”) i<-1 house_inf<-data.frame() for (i in 1:300){ web<- read_html(paste(“http://cd.lianjia.com/ershoufang/pg/d”,i,sep="“),encoding=”UTF-8") house_tag<-web%>%html_nodes(“div.info-table”)%>%html_text() # overallprice house_p <- web%>%html_nodes(“span.total-price”)%>%html_text() house_tag <- gsub(“,”“,house_tag) house_tag <- gsub(”“,”“,house_tag) #size house_size<-str_split_fixed(house_tag,” +\|“,7)[,1] #housetype <- gsub(”“,”“,housetype) #location house_loc<-str_split_fixed(house_tag,” +\|“,7)[,3] #price_unit house_unitprice<-str_split_fixed(house_tag,” +\|“,7)[,4] house_unitprice <- gsub(”.单价“,”“,house_unitprice) house_unitprice <- gsub(”元/平“,”“,house_unitprice) #m house_m<-str_split_fixed(house_tag,” +\|“,7)[,2] house_m <- gsub(”平.“,”“,house_m) #level house_level <- str_split_fixed(house_tag,” +\|“,7)[,2] house_level <- gsub(”.区/“,”“,house_level) house_level <- gsub(”层.“,”",house_level) house<-data_frame(house_p,house_size,house_loc,house_unitprice,house_m,house_level) house_inf<-rbind(house_inf,house) } #将数据写入csv文档 write.csv(house_inf,file=“house_inf.csv”)

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
